definition: to bring together/to make do in a bad situation/to just get by/to improvise/passable/not too bad
to gather together, pool or collect/to happen by chance/to move close to/to exploit an opportunity
100 ml/one-tenth of a peck/measure for dry grain equal to one-tenth of sheng 升 or liter, or one-hundredth dou 斗
to close/to join/to fit/to be equal to/whole/together/round (in battle)/conjunction (astronomy)/1st note of pentatonic scale/old variant of 盒[he2]

sentences.english: Knowing your own darkness is the best method for dealing with the darknesses of other people.
sentences.chinese: 理解自身的陰暗，是湊合他人陰暗一面的最好辦法。

sentences.english: There are so much variety that you never have to do with the second best.
sentences.chinese: 物品品種繁多，從來不必用二等品來湊合。

sentences.english: Chen Chen said, benefit also assembles, for a car to earn one thousand or two thousand.
sentences.chinese: 陳晨說，效益還湊合，辦理一輛車掙一兩千。

sentences.english: She'll make do with the old typewriter until the new one arrives.
sentences.chinese: 新打字機到之前她將湊合着用舊的。

sentences.english: I forgot the words of my speech, so I had to improvise .
sentences.chinese: 我忘了我的演講詞，所以我只得臨時湊合。

sentences.english: We threw together a meal out of leftovers.
sentences.chinese: 我們用剩菜剩飯匆匆湊合了一頓飯。

sentences.english: He overwhelmed so many of his opponents alone. Hers really something.
sentences.chinese: 他實了不訖，居然一個人湊合了這麼多的對手。

sentences.english: There is so much variety thatyou never have to make do with second best.
sentences.chinese: 物品種繁多，從來不必用二等品來湊合。

sentences.english: I think this is a feature that "just works" as I am not aware of JetBrains having worked on specific SCA integration.
sentences.chinese: 我認爲這僅僅是一種“湊合用”的特性。

sentences.english: They pieced out a meal from leftovers.
sentences.chinese: 他們用剩飯剩菜湊合成一頓飯。

sentences.english: I can make this padded jacket do for another winter.
sentences.chinese: 我這件棉襖湊合着還能穿一冬。

sentences.english: A tube cutter works best but you can use a hacksaw.
sentences.chinese: 最好用截管器，不過用鋼鋸也能湊合。

sentences.english: We can sleep on the beach. I don't mind roughing it for a night or two.
sentences.chinese: 我們可以在海邊睡覺，我不介意湊合著睡個一兩晚。

sentences.english: The rain, colors, and contrast just brought it all together.
sentences.chinese: 雨，色彩，對比度剛巧湊合地在一起。

sentences.english: He has not much money,but he rubs along all right.
sentences.chinese: 他沒有很多的錢，可是他可以湊合着過日子。

sentences.english: There is so much variety that you never have to make do with second best.
sentences.chinese: 物品品種繁多，從來不必用二等品來湊合。

definition: to live one's life/to pass one's days/to get along
there is nothing to be done/one can't do anything about it
as one wishes/as one pleases/at random/negligent/casual/wanton
to say again/to put off a discussion until later/moreover/what's more/besides
to accept (a bit reluctantly)/to put up with
not bad/tolerable/fortunately
we or us (including both the speaker and the person(s) spoken to)/(dialect) I or me/(dialect) (in a coaxing or familiar way) you/also pr. [za2 men5]
easy to deal with/not a problem/(polite answer) you flatter me
to give it a try
to be indifferent/not to matter/cannot be said to be
still/still in progress/still more/yet/even more/in addition/fairly/passably (good)/as early as/even/also/else
surname Huan
to pay back/to return
incorrect/wrong/amiss/abnormal/queer
a modal particle indicating (don't mind it, ok)
a modal particle indicating (that's all, only, nothing much)
ready-made/readily available
occasionally/once in a while/sometimes
dull/vapid/colorless
